poem:
Title: "A Song for Brianna"

Bright star-child, Brianna, eclipsed too soon,
Her radiant pulse echoes still, unending.
Wronged by ignorance's sharp, cruel edge.
Her voice stirred a melody within,
Cut short by an unforgiving blade.
May her spirit bloom like wildflowers after storm.
May we honor her memory, and learn,
For every heart demands to sing its own sacred song.
May the earth cradle her gentle, iridescent essence.
